greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (1+A003961(A003961(n)))/2 mod 3, where A003961 shifts the prime factorization of n one step towards larger primes.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: a(n) = [A340683(n)) == 0], where [ ] is the Iverson bracket.
program: A003961(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003961
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 09 2021
